intro: Galium commune var. papillosum, commonly known as the common bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender, often prostrate stems and opposite, lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters, which are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. Its flowers are pollinated by insects, and it is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
